imdb.title: JoJo no Kimyô na Bôken
imdb.plot: The story of the Joestar family, who are possessed with intense psychic strength, and the adventures each member encounters throughout their lives.

episodes.title: Seto-shin' no Aresshi Sono 1
episodes.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

episodes.title: The Beginning of Golden Wind
episodes.plot: A recap of Jojo's Bizarre Adventure: Golden Wind episodes 1 to 13 (Gold Experience to Man in the Mirror and Purple Haze)

episodes.title: Determination
episodes.plot: A recap of Jojo's Bizarre Adventure: Golden Wind episodes 14 to 21 (Express Train to Florence through The Mystery of King Crimson).

episodes.title: Destiny
episodes.plot: A recap of Jojo's Bizarre Adventure: Golden Wind episodes 22 to 28 (The "G" in Guts to Beneath a Sky on the Verge of Falling).

episodes.title: Stone Ocean
episodes.plot: Jolyne Kujo is framed for an accident, sentencing her to 15 years in Green Dolphin Street Prison.

episodes.title: Prisoner FE40536: Jolyne Cujoh
episodes.plot: Jolyne gets acquainted with Green Dolphin Street Prison and her two-faced cellmate, Gwess, who has obtained Jolyne's locket and a pint-sized new Stand.

episodes.title: The Visitor, Part 1
episodes.plot: Jolyne acclimates to prison, but a mysterious boy delivers an ominous message before Jolyne receives a visit from her father and an enemy Stand user.

episodes.title: The Visitor, Part 2
episodes.plot: DIO's follower Johngalli A. aims for revenge. The boy risks his safety to help Jotaro and Jolyne, but she refuses to leave the kid behind.

episodes.title: Prisoner of Love
episodes.plot: Father and daughter try to escape the visiting room's trap and the prison, but an enemy Stand extracts two discs from Jotaro. One holds Star Platinum.

episodes.title: Ermes's Stickers
episodes.plot: Jolyne returns to prison to retrieve Jotaro's discs. Ermes Costello discovers her new ability and a guard with discs in his head before she's attacked.

episodes.title: There's Six of Us!
episodes.plot: After people go missing from the prison's farm, Jolyne and Ermes volunteer to join the search party as a way to look for Pale Snake and the discs.

episodes.title: F.F.
episodes.plot: Jolyne and Ermes unravel the mystery of Stand F.F. and its user, who admits to helping Pale Snake in his efforts to steal their Stands.

episodes.title: Debt Collector Mary Lynn Manson
episodes.plot: Pale Snake's user, Father Pucchi, makes his entrance. A baseball game in the yard against Miraschon heats up when F.F. and Stone Ocean get involved.

episodes.title: Operation Savage Guardian (Head to the Courtyard!), Part 1
episodes.plot: Assisted by Emporio and his friend Weather Forecast, Jolyne rushes to the courtyard to pass Jotaro's Stand Disc to the Speedwagon Foundation.

episodes.title: Operation Savage Guardian (Head to the Courtyard!), Part 2
episodes.plot: Father Pucchi learns some damning information. Jolyne and Weather's bodies strain under Jumpin' Jack Spark's Stand ability as the fight continues.

episodes.title: Torrential Downpour Warning
episodes.plot: Jolyne reaches the courtyard. Pucchi recalls his talks with DIO and his reason for hunting Jotaro when Weather unleashes a squall of poison dart frogs.

episodes.title: Smack of Love and Revenge: Part 1
episodes.plot: Realizing she hasn't seen Ermes for a few days, a curious Jolyne looks into her past and discovers that she came to the prison for a certain purpose.

episodes.title: Smack of Love and Revenge: Part 2
episodes.plot: F.F. and Jolyne try to assist Ermes in her fight against Sports Maximum, but they struggle against his Stand's ability to control the dead.

episodes.title: Ultra Security House Unit
episodes.plot: In a bid to find the bone, Jolyne intentionally gets sent to the Ultra Security House Unit. Hoping to save her, F.F. turns to Anastasia for help.

episodes.title: The Secret of Guard Westwood
episodes.plot: The Stand Survivor sparks brawls throughout the Disciplinary Wing. While fighting off a prison guard, Jolyne realizes that he is also a Stand User.

episodes.title: Enter the Drake's Dream
episodes.plot: A victorious Jolyne looks out over the remaining prisoners. An old man approaches her and reveals he is a Stand User who has been sent by Pale Snake.

episodes.title: Enter the F.F.
episodes.plot: Jolyne notices that F.F. is becoming dangerously dehydrated in the fight against Kenzou and pleads with Anastasia to step in and help, but he refuses.

episodes.title: Birth of the "Green"
episodes.plot: After Jolyne and her companions catch up to the man who has the bone, they notice strange plant growths emerging from the nearby fallen prisoners.

episodes.title: F.F. - The Witness
episodes.plot: In a boat piloted by the obedient YA-YA MA, Jolyne and Anastasia flee through the wetlands. However, YA-YA MA attacks them with an invisible ability.

episodes.title: AWAKEN
episodes.plot: After realizing the connection between Father Pucchi and Pale Snake, F.F. defeats D an' G. As YA-YA MA disintegrates, the egg it swallowed hatches.

episodes.title: Time for Heaven! New Moon! New Priest!
episodes.plot: Weather Forecast summons some rain, which saves F.F. from the brink of destruction. They reunite with Jolyne and Anastasia, but the group gets attacked.

episodes.title: Lock of the Jail!
episodes.plot: Jolyne resolves to escape Green Dolphin Island and put a stop to Father Pucchi's ambitions. A prison guard brings her a message from Pale Snake.

episodes.title: Jailbreak...
episodes.plot: Guided by the words on her hand, Jolyne fights her fading memories, evades the prison guards and reaches the hidden room - just as Mew Mew planned.

episodes.title: Bohemian Ecstatic: Part 1
episodes.plot: With just five days until the new moon, Father Pucchi heads north and tries to stay ahead of Jolyne, but he is held hostage outside a hospital.

episodes.title: Bohemian Ecstatic: Part 2
episodes.plot: Splitting up with Weather Forecast, Anastasia tries to recover his physical body after the enemy Stand Bohemian Ecstatic separates it from his soul.

episodes.title: Sky Guy
episodes.plot: As Jolyne and her companions head toward Cape Canaveral in Romeo's helicopter, they are struck by something that forces their eyelids to close.

episodes.title: Heaven is at Hand: Three Days Until the New Moon
episodes.plot: Jolyne learns a shocking truth about Weather Forecast after her fight with Rikiel. She and Ermes enter the hospital and find a hole dug in the floor.

episodes.title: Netherworld
episodes.plot: Trapped by Versus's Stand in the memory of the crashed plane, Jolyne leaps from the aircraft and launches an attack, but it fails to affect Versus.

episodes.title: Heavy Forecast: Part 1
episodes.plot: With Weather Forecast's memories restored, his powerful ability Heavy Forecast triggers automatically, turning everyone affected by it into snails.

episodes.title: Heavy Forecast: Part 2
episodes.plot: Father Pucchi is born alongside his twin brother, who is switched with an ill-fated baby. As a young adult, he meets a strange man called DIO.

episodes.title: Heavy Forecast: Part 3
episodes.plot: The tragic history of Pucci and Weather Report is revealed.

episodes.title: Gravity of the New Moon
episodes.plot: With Weather Forecast's Stand disc in hand, Jolyne and her allies head to Cape Canaveral in pursuit of Father Pucchi, whose body begins to change.

episodes.title: See Moon: Part 1
episodes.plot: Jolyne struggles against Father Pucchi's new Stand See Moon, a combination of Pale Snake and The Green Baby, which can invert anything it touches.

episodes.title: See Moon: Part 2
episodes.plot: Although See Moon has inverted Jolyne, Father Pucchi senses that she is still alive and pursues her in hopes of ending the Joestar bloodline for good.

episodes.title: Maiden Heaven: Part 1
episodes.plot: After shafts of bright light shine from Father Pucchi, Jolyne and her companions awake to find that he is gone and gravity has returned to normal.

episodes.title: Maiden Heaven: Part 2
episodes.plot: Father Pucchi's new Stand Maiden Heaven overwhelms Jolyne's group with its sheer speed. Anastasia acts as bait while Jotaro prepares to attack.

episodes.title: It's a Wonderful World
episodes.plot: The unstoppable acceleration of time brings the universe full circle. Emporio awakes in Green Dolphin Street Prison, and humanity enters a new world.

episodes.title: Gold Experience
episodes.plot: Giorno Giovanna has a dream, to become a Gang-Star! Inspired by a man he saved as a child, he sets out to join the shady organisation, Passione. Accompanied by his fellow gang members, Bruno, Mista, Narancia and Fugo, he unearths a terrifying secret about the boss of Passione. With the power of Gold Experience and the help of his friends, Giorno strides forth to achieve his dream.

episodes.title: Bucciarati Is Coming
episodes.plot: Giorno is attacked by the mysterious Bruno Bucciarati. Using his Stand, Sticky Fingers, he relentlessly pursues Giorno. As he continues his fight with Bruno, Giorno reflects on his past and his decision to become a Gang-Star.

episodes.title: Meet the Gangster Behind the Wall
episodes.plot: In order to join the Passione organization, Giorno meets with Polpo, one of the capos in the gang who is currently in prison. He gives Giorno a test to prove his worth: keep a lighter burner for 24 hours without going out.

episodes.title: Joining the Gang
episodes.plot: Polpo's Stand, Black Sabbath, begins a relentless attack against Giorno from the shadows. As night begins to fall, Giorno is desperate to defeat his powerful foe. Will he be able to prove his worth and join the gang?

episodes.title: Find Polpo's Treasure
episodes.plot: Bruno introduces Giorno to the other members of his team, who do not take kindly to the newcomer. In order to rise through the ranks, Bruno decides to track down Polpo's hidden fortune. The team heads to Capri to find the lost treasure.

episodes.title: Moody Blues' Attack
episodes.plot: As the team is attacked by an unseen enemy, Abbacchio uses the power of his Stand, Moody Blues, to replay the past and understand the nature of their opponent.

episodes.title: Sex Pistols Appears, Part 1
episodes.plot: Torturing their enemy for information, the team learns that another Stand user is aiming to ambush them on Capri. Mista and Giorno go alone to the island to catch the enemy off guard.

episodes.title: Sex Pistols Appears, Part 2
episodes.plot: Mista's Stand, Six Bullets, fights against Sale and his stand, Arts and Crafts.

episodes.title: The First Orders from the Boss
episodes.plot: Having found Polpo's treasure, Bruno is promoted to the role of capo. The mysterious boss of the organization gives them a mission: protect his daughter Trish and bring him to her safely. However, from the shadows an enemy watches.

episodes.title: Hitman Team
episodes.plot: A hit-man team, that seeks to overthrow the boss of the organization, begins to search for Trish. One of its members, Formaggio, attacks Narancia. Narancia fights back with his Aerosmith but Formaggio manages to hide from his attacks.

episodes.title: Narancia's Aerosmith
episodes.plot: Narancia continues to shrink due to the power of Formaggio's Little Feet. His Stand shrinks as well and his attacks barely affect the relentless Formaggio. Narancia tries to think of a way out as Formaggio tortures him for Trish's location.

episodes.title: The Second Mission From the Boss
episodes.plot: Fugo, Abbachio, and Giorno head to Pompeii to retrieve a key for the boss. However, another member of the hit-man team, Illuso, attacks them with his Stand, Man in the Mirror.

episodes.title: Man in the Mirror and Purple Haze
episodes.plot: Fugo is still trapped in the mirror world due to Man in the Mirror, who continues its attack. Giorno and Abbachio try to think of a way to save their friend as Fugo's Purple Haze rampages in the real world.

episodes.title: Express Train to Florence
episodes.plot: Using the power of the key in conjunction with a turtle, the gang hides on a train bound for Venice. However, two members of the hit-man team board as well, with Prosciutto unleashing his Stand on the hapless passengers.

episodes.title: The Grateful Dead, Part 1
episodes.plot: The Grateful Dead slowly begins to age everybody on the train. With his teammates affected, Mista goes alone to confront the enemy, only to encounter Pesci and his Beach Boy.

episodes.title: The Grateful Dead, Part 2
episodes.plot: To protect his teammates, Bruno manages to knock Prosciutto off the train to negate the aging power of The Grateful Dead, However, Pesci's resolve is hardened seeing his brother fight and he continues to attack Bruno.

episodes.title: Baby Face
episodes.plot: The gang tries to steal a car to travel to Venice in secret. Another hit-man, Melone, uses his Baby Face to impregnate a woman and create a soldier that pursues Giorno and the others.

episodes.title: Head to Venice!
episodes.plot: With Baby Face defeated, the group continues driving to Venice. A chill is in the air however, as Ghiaccio and his cold manipulating White Album unleash a barrage of ice attacks on Giorno and Mista.

episodes.title: White Ice
episodes.plot: Giorno drives into the canals of Venice in the hope of shaking off Ghiaccio. However, his White Album only operates better in ice, especially when he unleashes the power of his Gently Weeps.

episodes.title: The Final Mission From The Boss
episodes.plot: The boss gives the gang one final mission: deliver Trish to the top of a bell tower. Bruno takes Trish to the tower, reflecting on his past arriving to this point, but that's when the boss reveals his horrific true nature.

episodes.title: The Mystery of King Crimson
episodes.plot: Bruno continues his desperate struggle against the boss, but cannot comprehend the nature of his Stand, King Crimson. When the dust settles, a decision is made that will change the lives of the gang forever.

episodes.title: The "G" in Guts
episodes.plot: Stopping for lunch at a cafe, the gang tries to determine what to do now that they are enemies of the Passione organization. Members of the elite squad then attack, unleashing the power of their Stands: Clash and Talking Head.

episodes.title: Clash and Talking Heads
episodes.plot: Squalo's Clash and Tiziano's Talking Head continue their combination attack to kill Giorno and finish off the gang. Forced to only tell lies, Narancia has to try to get his friends to go after the real enemy and save Giorno's life.

episodes.title: Notorious B.I.G
episodes.plot: The gang manage to acquire a plane and aim to fly to Sardinia, after dispatching an enemy. However, once they are in the air, they find themselves under attack by a powerful and terrifying foe.

episodes.title: Spice Girl
episodes.plot: On the verge of death, Trish discovers and unlocks a Stand power.

episodes.title: A Little Story From The Past ~My Name is Doppio~
episodes.plot: On the island of Sardinia, a boy named Doppio is searching for Trish and the others on orders from Passione's boss. But Doppio has a dark secret, one that becomes apparent when he encounters Risotto of La Squadra.

episodes.title: King Crimson vs. Metallica
episodes.plot: Doppio continues to fight against Risotto and his iron controlling Metallica. Doppio struggles against the powerful assassin, but is armed with King Crimson's Epitaph, which allows him to see the future.

episodes.title: Beneath a Sky on the Verge of Falling
episodes.plot: In the aftermath of the battle between Risotto and Doppio, Abbacchio uses Moody Blues to try and uncover the boss's identity. But the boss is adamant about keeping his identity a secret and executes his next gambit against the group.

episodes.title: Get to the Roman Colosseum!
episodes.plot: Unsure of what to do next, the gang receive a strange message on their computer revealing the origins of the Stand arrow and the true name of Passione's boss. The gang aim to travel to Rome as two assassins wait in the shadows.

episodes.title: Green Day and Oasis, Part 1
episodes.plot: The gang are under attack by the last two members of the Elite Squad. Cioccolata uses his Green Day to spread a toxic mold over the island while Secco uses Oasis to swim through rock for stealth attacks, leaving the gang in a pinch.

episodes.title: Green Day and Oasis, Part 2
episodes.plot: While Bruno stays on the ground to fight against Secco's Oasis, Giorno and Mista head upwards towards Cioccolata to stop the power of his Green Day. But Cioccolata has another dangerous trick up his sleeve, pushing the two into a corner.

episodes.title: Green Day and Oasis, Part 3
episodes.plot: Bruno and Secco are both racing towards the man at the Colloseum whilst trying to kill each other.

episodes.title: His Name is Diavolo
episodes.plot: Bruno unknowingly leads Doppio to the Colosseum while the rest of the gang is searching for their leader.

episodes.title: The Requiem Quietly Plays, Part 1
episodes.plot: Everyone wakes up from a deep sleep to discover their souls have been swapped.

episodes.title: The Requiem Quietly Plays, Part 2
episodes.plot: The gang desperately tries to reach the Stand arrow whilst looking for Diavolo.

episodes.title: Diavolo Surfaces
episodes.plot: Everyone continues to desperately chase after the Requiem in order to obtain the Stand arrow. Diavolo's soul is then forced to show itself, but he will not quit until he obtains the arrow for himself.

episodes.title: King of Kings
episodes.plot: The Stand arrow's rightful owner is finally revealed.

episodes.title: Gold Experience Requiem
episodes.plot: Giorno achieves his dream and destiny of becoming a Gang-star.

episodes.title: Sleeping Slaves
episodes.plot: In the past, Bruno and his team investigated the mysterious death of a girl and how it ties into the power known as Rolling Stones. And in the present, the final fate of Giorno and the gang is revealed as Golden Wind comes to a close.

episodes.title: Jotaro Kujo! Meets Josuke Higashikata
episodes.plot: Ten years after battle in Egypt, Jotaro Kujo arrives to Morioh in Japan looking for Josuke Higashikata. He need to talk to Josuke about Joestar's heritage and tells him about dangerous Stand User who's hiding in town.

episodes.title: Josuke Higashikata! Meets Angelo
episodes.plot: Angelo uses his Aqua Necklace to attack Josuke's family and succeeds in killing his grandfather. Hungry for revenge, Jotaro and Josuke prepare to fight Angelo once more.

episodes.title: The Nijimura Brothers' Part 1
episodes.plot: Angelo reveals that he was given his Stand by a man in a school uniform using an arrow. Josuke and Koichi pass by a wrecked house where they discover the brothers Okuyasu and Keicho.

episodes.title: The Nijimura Brothers' Part 2
episodes.plot: After defeating Okuyasu and The Hand, Josuke enters the house to save Koichi. However, he soons find himself under attack by Keicho and his army Stand, Bad Company.

episodes.title: The Nijimura Brothers' Part 3
episodes.plot: Josuke and Koichi learn that the Nijimura brothers were giving people Stands to try and create one that could save their father. But just as a ceasefire begins, another enemy Stand appears before them.

episodes.title: Koichi Hirose (Echoes)
episodes.plot: Koichi finds himself stalked by Tamami Kobayashi, who tries to scam him using The Lock. But when his family is in Tamami's crosshairs, Koichi finally awakens the power of his Stand, Echoes.

episodes.title: Toshikazu Hazamada
episodes.plot: Josuke and Koichi get info that a student at their school, Toshikazu Hazamada may be a Stand user and decide to look into the case. Their suspicions are quickly confirmed after Hazamada's wooden doll morphs into an exact copy of Josuke, and attacks them.

episodes.title: Yukako Yamagishi Falls in Love, Part 1
episodes.plot: Koichi finds that he has captured the attention of Yukako Yamagishi, who claims to be in love with him. Things seem fine, until Yukako reveals that her feelings for Koichi go far beyond a simple crush.

episodes.title: Yukako Yamagishi Falls in Love, Part 2
episodes.plot: Now Yukako's prisoner, Koichi tries to escape the deranged woman using Echoes. But when he is pushed into a corner by Love Deluxe, a new power awakens within Echoes.

episodes.title: Let's Go Eat Some Italian Food
episodes.plot: Josuke and Okuyasu decide to eat some Italian at a new restaurant run by Tonio Trussardi. However, the food starts affecting Okuyasu and Josuke in strange ways, as Tonio appears to have a Stand.

episodes.title: Red Hot Chili Pepper, Part 1
episodes.plot: The electric Stand Red Hot Chili Pepper appears to taunt Josuke before vanishing. The gang learn that its user is targeting Joseph Joestar, and attempt to stop Chili Pepper from killing him.

episodes.title: Red Hot Chili Pepper, Part 2
episodes.plot: Josuke and the gang continue to fight Red Hot Chili Pepper and its user, Akira Otoishi. Powered up by electricity, Red Hot Chili Pepper proves to be a powerful for as Joseph's boat gets closer to Morioh.

episodes.title: We Picked Up Something Crazy!
episodes.plot: Josuke and Joseph find an invisible baby and adopt it.

episodes.title: Let's Go to the Manga Artist's House, Part 1
episodes.plot: Hazamada and Koichi learn that one of their favorite mangaka, Rohan Kishibe, learns in Morioh. But when they go to visit him, the eccentric Rohan greets them with his Stand, Heaven's Door.

episodes.title: Let's Go to the Manga Artist's House, Part 2
episodes.plot: Rohan uses Heaven's Door to read the secrets of Josuke's friends and puts them under special locks so that they can't stop him. Angered at seeing his friends hurt, Josuke approaches Rohan.

episodes.title: Let's Go Hunting!
episodes.plot: Josuke and Jotaro go hunting for a rat that has been given Stand abilities. While searching for their target, they find living things melted into flesh cubes and soon learn it isn't as simple as a mere rat.

episodes.title: Rohan Kishibe's Adventure
episodes.plot: Rohan and Koichi investigate a strange alley in Morioh that does not appear on any map. They get more than they bargained for when they meet the ghosts of Reimi and Arnold, who warn them of a dangerous presence in Morioh.

episodes.title: Shigechi's Harvest, Part 1
episodes.plot: Josuke and Okuyasu see strange hornet Stands, belonging to Shigechi, stealing money from all around Morioh. The three work together in a get rich quick scheme that soon goes awry.

episodes.title: Shigechi's Harvest, Part 2
episodes.plot: Shigechi, Okuyasu, and Josuke find themselves blinded by greed as they fight over a lottery ticket. When Stands get involved, it turns into a mad brawl over who will get the money.

episodes.title: Yukako Yamagishi Dreams of Cinderella
episodes.plot: Yukako is feeling down about her looks when she meets Aya Tsuji and Cinderella. She offers to give Yukako a makeover, but little does she know that such beauty comes with a price

episodes.title: Yoshikage Kira Just Wants to Live Quietly, Part 1
episodes.plot: Yoshikage Kira is a simple businessman who just wants to enjoy his sandwich for lunch. But a minor scuffle with Shigechi escalates when a horrific secret is revealed.

episodes.title: Yoshikage Kira Just Wants to Live Quietly, Part 2
episodes.plot: Shigechi desperately tries to flee from Yoshikage Kira and Killer Queen, which can turn anything into a bomb. As he perishes, Shigechi gets a clue to Josuke and the others that sets them on a new path.

episodes.title: Sheer Heart Attack, Part 1
episodes.plot: Kira uses Sheer Heart Attack to kill his tailor and fight Josuke to prevent anyone from learning his secret. The indestructible tank proves to be tough, until Echoes manages to evolve yet again into Act 3.

episodes.title: Sheer Heart Attack, Part 2
episodes.plot: With Sheer Heart Attack beaten, Jotaro and Koichi finally encounter Kira himself. It seems like the final battle is underway as Stands clash, but then.....

episodes.title: Atom Heart Father
episodes.plot: Searching for more clues about Kira, Josuke and the others investigate his old house. But Kira's father, still alive as a ghost, is determined to protect his son and unleashes Atom Heart Father on them.

episodes.title: Janken Boy is Coming!
episodes.plot: Rohan encounters a boy named Ken, who is obsessed with janken. He accepts the boys challenge, only to end up playing a dangerous game with his Stand, Boy II Man.

episodes.title: I am an Alien
episodes.plot: Josuke and Okuyasu encounter a weird boy named Mikitaka, who claims to be an alien. Possessing weird powers but no Stand, Mikitaka appears to be telling the truth as Josuke gets an idea.

episodes.title: Highway Star, Part 1
episodes.plot: Rohan and Josuke's game ends without Mikitala being discovered. As Rohan discovers something odd while on the train, a boy named Hayato suspects that his dad is acting strange.

episodes.title: Highway Star, Part 2
episodes.plot: Rohan has his energy drained by a nefarious Stand in Futatsumori Tunnel. Josuke flees the pursuing Highway Star on a motorcycle to try and track down its user at the hospital in town.

episodes.title: The Cat Likes Yoshikage Kira
episodes.plot: Kira has stolen the identity of another man to live in his house. He discovers a dead cat and buries it, only for the cat to resurrect as a Stand that still has a desire for revenge.

episodes.title: July 15th (Thurs), Part 1
episodes.plot: On July 15th, Josuke and the others discover a man living in an electric pylon and fall under the spell of Super Fly. Even stranger things then start happening over Morioh.

episodes.title: July 15th (Thurs), Part 2
episodes.plot: While Rohan deals with an odd architect who is terrified of his own back, Josuke defeats Super Fly only to encounter Terunosuke and his paper controlling Enigma.

episodes.title: July 15th (Thurs), Part 3
episodes.plot: Josuke succumbs to fear and is turned into paper , leading Yuya and Highway Star to save him. Rohan looks at the architect's back and becomes cursed by the Stand Cheap Trick.

episodes.title: July 15th (Thurs), Part 4
episodes.plot: Rohan tries to prevent anyway from seeing his back to avoid Cheap Trick's curse. Hayato sees Kira in action and confronts the imposter posing as his dad with hard evidence.

episodes.title: Another One Bites the Dust, Part 1
episodes.plot: Kira gets a new power and tests it out on Hayato.

episodes.title: Another One Bites the Dust, Part 2
episodes.plot: Hayato has gone back in time and attempts to warn everyone about Kira, but will he able to stop history from repeating?

episodes.title: Crazy Diamond Is Unbreakable, Part 1
episodes.plot: Having inadvertently revealed his true identity to Josuke, Yoshikage Kira is forced to fight him alongside Okuyasu, but does he have a trick up his sleeve?

episodes.title: Crazy Diamond Is Unbreakable, Part 2
episodes.plot: The battle between Josuke and Kira continues

episodes.title: Goodbye, Morioh - The Heart of Gold
episodes.plot: The final battle between Kira and the Morioh Warriors comes to a climactic end.

episodes.title: Akuryô ni toritsukareta otoko
episodes.plot: In 1987, Japan. Jotaro Kujo from the Joestars has been captured in prison. As Jotaro's mother Holly worries about his son for he refuses to be free claiming he is obsessed by evil spirit, she asks Jotaro's grandfather Joseph in USA for help. Soon Joseph comes to Japan, he and his friend Avdol visit Jotaro and tell him that they know what the evil spirit is. They start talking about its true shape and the fate of his family..

episodes.title: Sabaku no wa dare da!?
episodes.plot: Jotaro finds out that the "evil spirit" he has is actually called a Stand, on the way to school one day, he sustains a very odd injury and meets a new transfer student named Noriaki Kakyoin.

episodes.title: Dio no jubaku
episodes.plot: Jotaro is able to defeat Kakyoin. He takes the wounded Kakyoin back to his house, hoping to get some information about Dio.

episodes.title: Tawâ obu Gurê
episodes.plot: If they do not defeat Dio within 50 days, Holly could die - Jotaro and crew head to Egypt, where they think Dio is hiding. While on the plane, they run into another one of Dio's assassins.

episodes.title: Shirubâ chariottsu
episodes.plot: Dio's next assassin, Polnareff attacks Jotaro and crew, Avdol faces him with his Magician's Red.

episodes.title: Dâku burû mûn
episodes.plot: With a new person in their party, they head to Singapore with the boat the Speedwagon Foundation provided them, during their journey Jotaro is targeted by an enemy Stand from within the water.

episodes.title: Sutorengusu
episodes.plot: A giant ship shows itself . On board, they realize they can't seem to find a crew, but an orangutan.

episodes.title: Debiru
episodes.plot: Arrived at Singapore, Jotaro's group stay at hotel individualy. A new Stand owner who is afraid as "Devo the Cursed" is awaited Polnareff in his room. Devo's Stand increases its power as its user's hatred toward opponent increases. Polnareff gets into desperate situation as he starts fighting front. Does Polnareff have a chance to win the battle from Devo who keeps attacking him with cruel and brutal way?

episodes.title: Ierô Tenparansu
episodes.plot: Joseph uses Hermit Purple to create a message using the TV, which tells them that Kakyoin is a traitor.

episodes.title: Enperâ to Hangudoman sono 1
episodes.plot: The group travels to India. In a restaurant Polnareff is attacked by a mysterious Stand that is inside a mirror.

episodes.title: Enperâ to Hangudoman sono 2
episodes.plot: In an effort to save Poinareff, Avdol is injured by the enemy. Then Centerfold's Stand, Hanged Man attacks.

episodes.title: Enpuresu
episodes.plot: The group heads toward Varanasi. On the way, Joseph realizes his arm is quite swollen.

episodes.title: Howîru obu fôchun
episodes.plot: Jotaro's group is on their way to Pakistan from India on 4WD car. Polnareff is driving the car and passes old car by force on rough mountain path. They enjoy their drive for a while but the old car starts tailgating from behind them so they let the car go ahead. Soon, the old car slows down again and the car keeps annoying drive. Just as Polnareff passes the old car again, a large truck is coming in front of them!.

episodes.title: Jasutisu sono 1
episodes.plot: Jotaro and his fellows finally arrive at Pakistan after they avoided Stand user's disturb. They try to find hotel for a dense fog begin to wrap them. The town they arrived is weirdly calm and people there are brusque to them. Then, they find an unusual dead body who made grimace of fear. They are suspicious that the man must be killed by Stand for it seems that the body was died for unknown cause. They become cautious of their surroundings and then an old woman who says she owns a hotel talk to them but ...?

episodes.title: Jasutisu sono 2
episodes.plot: Polnareff notices that Enyaba is the new assassin sent from DIO. Polnareff tries to let his fellows know this but then Enyaba's Stand controls many dead bodies to attack him. Whole town is under control of Enyaba. With nothing to do to fight back with the huge power of the Stand, Polnareff runs around to escape. Finally he gets injured by the enemy's attack and falls into Enyaba's trap...!.

episodes.title: Rabâzu sono 1
episodes.plot: Jotaro and his fellows catch Enyaba in alive and they arrive at Karachi, a capital city in Pakistan. A new assassin sent from DIO is called Dan of Steel and waiting for them there. To obey DIO's order, Dan kills his fellow, Enyaba without hesitating. Jotaro and his fellows get angry at its heartless action and they start fighting with Dan of Steel in advantaged situation, 4 VS 1. But Dan of Steel has been already started his dreadful attack using Stand..

episodes.title: Rabâzu sono 2
episodes.plot: Dan of Steel's Stand Lovers invaded into Joseph's brain. Dan who controls Joseph's life gets overwhelmingly strong position and he repeats base action to Jotaro. Jotaro can't go against Dan and he obeys Dan's order. On the other hand, Kakyoin succeeds to let his Stand invade into Joseph's brain and they find enemy's Stand which is eating brain cell. But the enemy is very quick and he has hard time to beat it. Furthermore, additional trap is set for them.

episodes.title: San
episodes.plot: Jotaro and his fellows arrive at the United Arab Emirates and they get on camels to across the desert. On their way, they sense sign of somebody though nobody except them should be there. Jotaro looks around using Star Platinum but nothing found. Then, they notices that sun rises in the west not setting in east even though it's over 8 pm! It does seem to be Stand of enemy's doing but they think of nothing to cope with it. Temperature keeps going up and finally rises above 70℃...!?

episodes.title: Desu Sâtîn sono 1
episodes.plot: Noriaki Kakyoin was dreaming. He found a tarot card of Death in strange amusement park where he heard cry of baby. Kakyoin dodged a sickle which suddenly came out from tarot card and the sickle cut a dog's body which was around him. He wakes up with screaming but he can't remember what the dream is. Soon after that, Jotaro and his fellows are heading for next town by plane and they let a baby get on the plane with them as a condition to buy small plane. Kakyoin and Polnareff are napping on the plane and they have dream of that amusement park.

episodes.title: Desu Sâtîn sono 2
episodes.plot: Kakyoin is suspicious about the baby but nobody believes his opinion and others begin to think that Kakyoin gets crazy. Trying to clear the misunderstanding, Kakyoin shows his scar which he cuts as "BABY STAND" in dream but others don't believe him. Irritated Kakyoin tries to use his Stand but Polnareff let him faint by hitting his body to him. Jotaro and others who fell asleep wake up in their dream with shudder to see what the truth is.

episodes.title: Jajjimento sono 1
episodes.plot: Jotaro and his fellows leave for a desert island in Red Sea to see somebody. Arrived at the island, they meet with a man who totally looks like Avdol except his gray hair - it turns out he is Avdol's father. The man refuses to talk with Jotaro and others then he shuts himself in his house. Polnareff is sitting in the beach in deep sorrow thinking about Avdol who was died to protect him. Then, he finds strange lamp which barnacles attaching on. He scrapes the barnacles off then the lamp suddenly emit light and ...!?

episodes.title: Jajjimento sono 2
episodes.plot: Polnareff gets injured by his sister Shelly who comes to life again as Polnareff said his wish. Cameo who is the Stand user of Judgement tells Polnareff that he will make his third wish come true and let the dead Avdol come to life again. Shelly and Avdol attack him to bite off Polnareff's body. He tries to fight back using his Stand but Cameo won't let him forcing him into dangerous situation. He is about to lose consciousness and determines his death..

episodes.title: Hai Puriesutesu sono 1
episodes.plot: Jotaro and his fellows acquired submarine as new transportation. Leaving Red Sea, they head for the continent of Africa to land in Egypt where DIO is. They calmly travel below sea looking around with submarine's sonar. Jotaro points out that it will be extremely dangerous if they get attacked below sea because there's no way to run away so they keep guard on their surroundings. When they are about to land in the continent of Africa, a coffee cup transform itself and cut off Joseph's artificial arm.

episodes.title: Hai Puriesutesu sono 2
episodes.plot: Jotaro and his fellows are trying to escape from sinking submarine which got attacked by enemy's Stand High Priestess. Enemy's stand attacks them again who are trying to wear scuba diving equipment to swim. Being played by transforming Stand, they finally get out from submarine. They swim toward land keeping guard on further attacks, then they find two under sea tunnels and get relieved to know that they are approaching to coast but...?

episodes.title: Iggy the Fool and Geb's N'Doul, Part 1
episodes.plot: After a stand user named Iggy, a dog, arrives to accompany Jotaro they discover a stand made of water.

episodes.title: Iggy the Fool and Geb's N'Doul, Part 2
episodes.plot: The group's battle with the water stand continues.

episodes.title: Kunumu-shin' no Oingo to 'Toto-shin' no Boingo
episodes.plot: Two brothers - Oingo, who can disguise himself, and Boingo, who can predict the future - set traps for Jotaro's group. But they end up as epic failures.

episodes.title: Anubisu-shin' Sono 1
episodes.plot: A young man named Chaka finds a mysterious sword on the beach. Though other men try, Chaka is the only one who can draw it. The sword claims Chaka as its master and sends the youth in pursuit of Jotaro and his friends with deadly intent.

episodes.title: Anubisu-shin' Sono 2
episodes.plot: Having defeated the "Anubis" Stand user Chaka, Polnareff pays a visit to a barber. But when the barber starts attacking him with Chaka's sword, the Frenchman realizes the sword itself is the Stand user.

episodes.title: Basuteto-joshin' no Maraia Sono 1
episodes.plot: On the way to Luxor, Joseph notices an electrical outlet set in a rock. Fascinated by the rare sight, Joseph goes in for a closer look and gets shocked. Though he seems fine afterwards, soon all manner of small accidents begin to occur around him.

episodes.title: Bastet's Mariah, Part 2
episodes.plot: Due to the powers of an enemy Stand, Joseph's body becomes magnetized. While chasing after the woman he suspects is the Stand user, Joseph learns that Avdol has also become magnetized from touching a different electrical outlet.

episodes.title: Set's Alessi, Part 1
episodes.plot: While Joseph and Avdol are fighting with Mariah, Jotaro gets concerned that they haven't shown up yet, and goes to look for them around Luxor. Then, Polnareff senses someone following them and confronts the man.

episodes.title: Set's Alessi, Part 2
episodes.plot: Because of the power of Alessi's Stand, Set, Polnareff is turned back into a child. The one who came to his aid amidst his confusion was a woman named Marena. However, Alessi's evil hands followed Polnareff into her house.

episodes.title: D'Arby the Gambler, Part 1
episodes.plot: Arriving in Cairo, the Stardust Crusaders try to discover where Dio is, only to encounter D'Arby the Gambler. He is willing to give them the information they want, but only if they bet their souls against him in a game.

episodes.title: D'Arby the Gambler, Part 2
episodes.plot: With Joseph and Polnareff taken, Jotaro stands up to play D'Arby in a game of poker. With Osiris ready to steal Jotaro's soul, D'Arby is confident until he notices Jotaro's icy calm.

episodes.title: Hol Horse and Boingo, Part 1
episodes.plot: Hol Horse tries to take out Jotaro's group again, and enlists the future-telling Boingo to aid him.

episodes.title: Hol Horse and Boingo, Part 2
episodes.plot: Every time Boingo makes a prediction and Hol Horse tries to follow it, it goes wrong.

episodes.title: The Guardian of Hell, Pet Shop, Part 1
episodes.plot: Iggy separates from the group and has a bizarre adventure of his own.

episodes.title: The Guardian of Hell, Pet Shop, Part 2
episodes.plot: Under attack by Pet Shop and his Horus, Iggy has no choice but to flee into the sewers. Iggy can only hide using The Fool as the fearsome Pet Shop continues his barrage of ice attacks.

episodes.title: D'Arby the Player, Part 1
episodes.plot: Inside Dio's mansion, Terence T. D'Arby uses his Atum to drag the group into an illusion. With their souls on the line, the gang meet his challenge in a series of video games.

episodes.title: D'Arby the Player, Part 2
episodes.plot: Kakyoin is defeated by D'Arby and has his soul sealed inside of a puppet. Despite having no knowledge of games, Jotaro faces D'Arby next in a baseball game.

episodes.title: The Miasma of the Void, Vanilla Ice, Part 1
episodes.plot: As Jotaro and Joseph continue to face off against D'Arby, Avdol and the others continue to explore the mansion. Little do they know that Dio's servant is watching them and unleashes his terrifying power.

episodes.title: The Miasma of the Void, Vanilla Ice, Part 2
episodes.plot: Vanilla Ice, now powered up by Dio, uses his Cream to disintegrate Avdol. Iggy and Polnareff desperately try to fight back, but he remains too powerful for the duo to take down.

episodes.title: The Miasma of the Void, Vanilla Ice, Part 3
episodes.plot: Polnareff is ready to accept his defeat, only to be rescued by the dying Iggy and harden's his resolve. Suzi comforts her daughter as Jotaro and Joseph get closer to where Dio lies in wait.

episodes.title: Dio's World, Part 1
episodes.plot: The Joestar group begin the fight against Dio, as Kakyoin learns the full extent of Dio's true power.

episodes.title: Dio's World, Part 2
episodes.plot: Kakyoin discovers The World's true power. The fight between Jotaro and Dio begins.

episodes.title: Dio's World, Part 3
episodes.plot: The fight between Jotaro and Dio continues.

episodes.title: Long Journey Farewell, My Friends
episodes.plot: The final battle between Jotaro and Dio comes to a climactic end.

episodes.title: Dio the Invader
episodes.plot: In Victorian England, a coach meets with disaster, forever changing the fate of the accident's sole survivors.

episodes.title: Kako kara no tegami
episodes.plot: Hostility grows between Jonathan and Dio, and forgotten secrets emerge; Jonathan is suspicious about the secret to the mask.

episodes.title: Dio to no seishun
episodes.plot: Having found an antidote and saved George, JoJo prepares to have Dio arrested. Speedwagon, who followed JoJo from London, helps prove Dio's guilt by presenting the druggist who sold Dio the poison. In a scuffle, Dio tries to stab JoJo but fatally injures George instead. After spilling George's blood on the mask and putting it on, Dio is shot to death by the police. Dying, George gives JoJo his late mother's ring, admitting that he knew of Dario's true nature before taking Dio in. Dio comes back to life as a vampire, proving invincible to firearms and draining the ...

episodes.title: Hamon shissô ôbâdoraibu
episodes.plot: Three days after Dio's attack on him and his father, JoJo awakens to find Erina nursing him back to health in a hospital. A strange man named Will A. Zeppeli arrives and shows JoJo how to employ the Ripple, which uses the energy of one's body to perform impressive feats of strength. Zeppeli also reveals that Dio is still alive and it is JoJo's destiny to defeat the stone mask. Meanwhile, Dio continues to prowl London, recruiting the vilest men, including Jack the Ripper, into his undead army. As Zeppeli trains JoJo to master the Ripple, he explains that as one of the ...

episodes.title: Ankoku no kishi-tachi
episodes.plot: Upon arriving in Windknights Lot, JoJo, Zeppeli and Speedwagon are lured by Poco, a talented pickpocket, to a graveyard at sunset. When Dio confronts them with a legion of zombies, Zeppeli tries to use a Ripple attack, but Dio counters by freezing Zeppeli's veins and also JoJo's hand. Dio then summons two powerful zombie knights, Tarkus and Bruford, to finish the job for him. As JoJo struggles against them, Speedwagon uses his body heat to thaw Zeppeli's arm. JoJo finally uses an air pocket from under a rock to utilize his ripple energy and launch an Overdrive attack ...

episodes.title: Atashi no yûki
episodes.plot: JoJo's battle with Bruford continues, with JoJo channeling an Overdrive attack through Bruford's sword. As Bruford's body disintegrates, he regains his human soul and becomes peaceful, leaving JoJo his sword. While Tarkus attacks, JoJo and Zeppeli transport Speedwagon and Poco to safety by using a bunch of leaves as a hang glider. Tarkus leaps after them, leading to a battle on a knights training ground. JoJo is thrust into a Chain Neck Deathmatch, in which one fighter must decapitate the other in order to free himself. Realizing that JoJo will be killed if no one ...

episodes.title: Uketsugu mono
episodes.plot: As JoJo continues fighting Tarkus, Zeppeli recalls that Tonpetty, who taught him how to use the Ripple, foretold Zeppeli's death in the very place he is right now. Zeppeli defends JoJo but is ripped in two. Using the last of his strength, Zeppeli transfers his Ripple energy into JoJo, allowing him to heal his injuries, break free from his chains and obliterate Tarkus. As JoJo, Speedwagon and Poco make their way back to Windknights Lot, they meet Tonpetty, along with his other students, Dire and Straizo. They also learn that Poco's sister, Peggy, has been kidnapped by ...

episodes.title: Kessen JoJo & Dio
episodes.plot: After Dio sends a zombie named Doobie to attack Poco's sister, JoJo saves her, despite the fact that Doobie's head is filled with poisonous snakes. JoJo's compatriot sacrifices himself, teaching JoJo that he can damage Dio using the sword he received from Bruford. But Dio freezes the sword, followed by JoJo heating it with a torch. Finally, JoJo sets his fists on fire and breaks through Dio's defenses with an Overdrive attack. As his body melts and he falls into the abyss, Dio launches a final attack that pierces JoJo's hand. With Dio presumed dead, JoJo takes a ...

episodes.title: Saigo no hamon
episodes.plot: JoJo thinks he has killed Dio, but Dio decapitated himself before the Ripple reached him. Dio's zombie servant Wang Chung recovers Dio's head. Meanwhile, with the stone mask destroyed, JoJo marries Erina and takes her on a honeymoon cruise to America. Thanks to Wang Chung, however, JoJo must eventually face the resurrected Dio, who now wants JoJo's body to replace his own. The cruise ship runs amok with zombies after Wang Chung spreads the infection, but JoJo destroys them all by exploding the ship using the last Ripple energy he has. Erina vows to die by JoJo's side,...

episodes.title: Nyû Yôku no JoJo
episodes.plot: In 1938, 49 years after JoJo's death, his compatriots Speedwagon and Straizo travel to Mexico, where they discover an underground room filled with masks and a petrified body believed to be the one who created them. Straizo betrays Speedwagon by using one of the masks to become a vampire. Meanwhile, in New York, JoJo's grandson, also nicknamed JoJo, uses the Ripple to save a young pickpocket named Smokey Brown from corrupt policemen. Smokey is taken in by Erina, while Straizo confronts JoJo.

episodes.title: Gêmu no tatsujin
episodes.plot: JoJo's compatriot Straizo, now a vampire, uses a laser eye attack to pierce JoJo's head and neck. But JoJo tricks him and responds with a Ripple attack that Straizo fends off by using a scarf woven from beetle muscles. After JoJo explodes Straizo with grenades, the opponent reassembles himself and takes a hostage. JoJo finally defeats Straizo by reflecting his laser eye back onto him and combining it with a Ripple attack. Before committing suicide, Straizo warns JoJo of a "Pillar Man" who will soon awaken. Meanwhile, Speedwagon is being interrogated in Mexico by a ...

episodes.title: Hashira no otoko
episodes.plot: After finding out that Speedwagon is alive, JoJo defends himself from one of Stroheim's men. Meanwhile, Stroheim awakens the Pillar Man, whom he dubs Santana, by sacrificing several prisoners in order to flood the chamber with blood. To test Santana, Stroheim sends a vampire after him and observes Santana absorbing it into his body as food. But Santana escapes, easily killing Stroheim's men by mimicking their gunfire. Only JoJo and his Ripple powers stand in Santana's way.

episodes.title: JoJo vs. kyûkyoku seibutsu
episodes.plot: Although his Ripple protects him somewhat, JoJo is not strong enough to withstand Santana's attacks. He receives a powerful hit and is absorbed by Santana -- but it's all part of JoJo's plan to get inside Santana so he can use the Ripple to destroy him from within. JoJo tries to drag Santana into the sunlight in order to kill him, but Santana's absorbing flesh keeps him from reaching the top of the stairs. When Stroheim tries to open the door to the outside, Santana ensnares Stroheim's leg, forcing JoJo to chop it off. But Santana dives into Stroheim's body to avoid ...

episodes.title: Taiko kara kita kyûkyoku senshi
episodes.plot: Speedwagon brings Santana's remains to his foundation in Washington, DC, and discovers that Santana is merely dormant. Remembering Stroheim's message that there are three more powerful Pillar Men somewhere in Europe, JoJo and Speedwagon travel to Rome to meet Zeppeli's grandson, Caesar, who is also skilled in using the Ripple. Caesar tests JoJo's abilities and is defeated. Caesar is about to show JoJo and Speedwagon where the Pillar Men are being kept when one of them, Wamuu, breaks free, killing a group of soldiers and awakening his masters, Kars and Esidisi. When ...

episodes.title: Hîrô no shikaku
episodes.plot: Caesar battles Wamuu, using his Bubble Launcher technique to surround the Pillar Man in Ripple-infused bubbles. But Wamuu unleashes a wind that bursts all of the bubbles, creating hundreds of miniature tornadoes that shred Caesar's skin. The Pillar Men learned how to defeat Ripple users millennia ago. JoJo then tries out his new Ripple technique, channeling it through two clackers. After a fight, the Pillar Men retreat in order to search for the Red Stone of Aja. Caesar promises to team up with JoJo and get stronger for the coming battles.

episodes.title: Hamon kyôshi Risa Risa
episodes.plot: To help JoJo control his Ripple powers, Caesar takes him to his trainer, Lisa Lisa, in Venice. Lisa Lisa makes JoJo wear a mask to limit his breathing and help him focus. She also orders JoJo and Caesar to ascend the Hell Climb Pillar, a 24-meter pole covered in oil that they can only overcome using the Ripple. JoJo learns how to focus Ripple energy into just his fingertips. After days of effort, they both figure out how to use the Ripple to succeed in the challenge. With JoJo ready for his next test, Lisa Lisa brings in her servants, Messina and Loggins, to teach him...

episodes.title: Fukaku wana wo hare!
episodes.plot: Lisa Lisa explains to JoJo and Caesar how Kars, the creator of the stone mask, is seeking a perfectly cut Red Stone of Aja known as the Super Aja to power the stone mask and become the ultimate life-form. When her assistant, Suzi Q, comes in with a ruby necklace, Lisa Lisa reveals that she herself possesses the Super Aja, capable of amplifying the light of the sun into a powerful beam. JoJo thinks they should destroy the stone, but Lisa Lisa tells him that the Super Aja is needed to defeat the Pillar Men. She pits JoJo and Caesar against Loggins and Messina for their ...

episodes.title: Shutorohaimu tai no gyakushû
episodes.plot: Before JoJo can warn Lisa Lisa about the Pillar Men, Esidisi's brain takes over Suzi Q's body and sends the Super Aja off on a boat. JoJo and Caesar are unable to kill Esidisi without also killing Suzi Q, but they can combine their Ripples to force Esidisi's brain out of Suzi Q and into the sunlight, burning him into nothingness. JoJo, Caesar, Lisa Lisa and Messina catch a train to Switzerland to reclaim the Super Aja, but German officials beat them to it, claiming the Red Stone of Aja for themselves and attacking the lodge where JoJo and the others are staying. JoJo ...

episodes.title: Shi no gake e tsuppashire
episodes.plot: Stroheim uses his new mechanical body, which was designed to surpass even Santana's, to fight Kars for the Super Aja. Kars's Light Mode literally cuts Stroheim down to size, but Stroheim fires a beam of ultraviolet light at Kars, almost sending the stone off a cliff. As JoJo and Kars dive after it, JoJo softens his fall by chaining icicles together. Kars also survives and hides out. JoJo resolves not to fight Kars on his home turf, angering Caesar. Lisa Lisa and Messina calm them down, but Caesar heads off alone. Lisa Lisa tells JoJo about Caesar's past to help him ...

episodes.title: Shîzâ kodoku no seishun
episodes.plot: Lisa Lisa tells JoJo about Caesar's childhood and how he took to crime at a young age after being abandoned by his debt-ridden father, Mario. When Caesar turned 16, he discovered the Pillar Men, and his father was killed by Kars. Meanwhile, in the present day, as Caesar arrives at the hotel, he is attacked by Wamuu, who uses streams of moist air to both protect him from the sunlight and reflect the light around him. Using his new Bubble Cutter attack, a series of refractive bubble lenses, Caesar redirects sunlight to pin down Wamuu, but Wamuu delivers a critical ...

episodes.title: Hyaku tai ni no kakehiki
episodes.plot: JoJo and Lisa track down Wamuu, who waits for them with Kars and 100 vampire minions. Lisa Lisa bluffs, saying that if both she and JoJo are killed, a bomb will destroy the Red Stone of Aja. While retrieving the Red Stone, JoJo finds a picture of his grandmother, Erina, from fifty years ago and learns that Lisa Lisa was rescued from the sinking boat by Erina and raised by Straizo, who taught her about the Ripple and gave her the Red Stone. Also, JoJo and Wamuu prepare for a chariot race using vampire horses.

episodes.title: Shin no kakutôsha
episodes.plot: JoJo and Wamuu take part in a chariot race in which various weapons can be grabbed from pillars. JoJo gets a head start by obstructing Wamuu's wheels with rubble and acquires the first weapon, a sledgehammer. However, Wamuu uses the pillar itself as a weapon and then hides inside his horse and launches a Holy Sandstorm attack that Jojo turns back on Wamuu with the Ripple. After Wamuu gouges out his own eyes and grows a horn that can sense the wind, he hits JoJo using a crossbow. JoJo is able to distract Wamuu's senses with pebbles, however, and land a Ripple-charged ...

episodes.title: Kaze ni kaeru senshi
episodes.plot: Launching a final attack that peels away his own body, Wamuu fires a cutting stream of wind at JoJo, who retaliates with a firebomb and Caesar's flaming bandana. After Wamuu shreds both weapons with his wind, he breathes them in and explodes. Realizing that Wamuu's wounds are fatal, JoJo gives Wamuu some of his blood as a sign of respect to ease his passing. When the other vampires suddenly attack, Wamuu uses the last of his strength to kill them and dies without regrets. Now it's time for Lisa Lisa's battle with Kars, who immediately demonstrates that he doesn't ...

episodes.title: JoJo wo musubu kizuna
episodes.plot: Clinging onto a rope to stop Lisa Lisa from falling to her death, JoJo manages to get Kars to fall onto the sharp crystals instead. As JoJo rescues Lisa Lisa, Speedwagon explains to Smokey how Lisa Lisa was raised by Straizo, who taught her the ways of the Ripple. She later met and was courted by Jonathan and Erina's son, George Joestar II, with their marriage resulting in the birth of JoJo. George II ultimately joined the Royal Air Force and battled in World War I as an ace fighter pilot.

episodes.title: Chô-seibutsu no tanjô!!
episodes.plot: Immune to the rising sun due to the power of the Red Stone, Kars injures Stroheim by turning his own hand into a flesh-eating squirrel. But JoJo grabs the stone and boards an airplane to lure Kars away from the others, planning to drop him into a volcano. The feathers that Kars placed on JoJo's plane then turn into piranhas that cause the plane to lose control. Using his parachute, JoJo maneuvers Kars into the path of the airplane as it heads toward the volcanic crater. As Stroheim saves JoJo from the crashing plane, Kars melts in the lava, apparently defeated by the ...

episodes.title: Kami to natta otoko
episodes.plot: Kars and the Pillar Men are the remnants of a fourth underground race of humanity that. In his desire for power, Kars exterminated the others, leading to the stone mask creation. During the final battle, JoJo's victory -- and his arm -- are cut short when Kars survives the volcano by forming an air bubble shield. Kars learned how to use the Ripple at a much stronger potency than JoJo's. As Kars is about to kill JoJo, JoJo holds up the Red Stone of Aja, causing the island to erupt and launch them into the sky. Kars disappears while JoJo rests on the Earth that dealt ...
